outputs.name: model
outputs.description:
A Fairyfly Model object possessing all of the input geometry
objects.

inputs.name: shapes_
inputs.description:
A list of honeybee Rooms to be added to the Model. Note that at
least one Room is necessary to make a simulate-able energy model.

inputs.name: boundaries_
inputs.description:
A list of fairyfly Boundary objects to be added to the Model.
Note that at least two distinct boundary conditions are necessary
to make a simulate-able THERM model.

inputs.name: _name_
inputs.description:
Text to be used for the Model name. If no name is provided, it
will be "unnamed".

code:
try:  # import the core fairyfly dependencies
    from fairyfly.model import Model
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import fairyfly:\n\t{}'.format(e))

try:  # import the ladybug_{{cad}} dependencies
    from ladybug_{{cad}}.{{plugin}} import all_required_inputs, give_warning
    from ladybug_{{cad}}.config import units_system, current_tolerance, angle_tolerance
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import ladybug_{{cad}}:\n\t{}'.format(e))


def check_all_geo_none():
    """Check whether all of the geometry inputs to this component are None."""
    return all(obj_list == [] or obj_list == [None] for obj_list in
               (shapes_, boundaries_))


if all_required_inputs(ghenv.Component) and not check_all_geo_none():
    # check the {{Cad}} Model units
    units, tolerance = units_system(), current_tolerance()
    tol_msg = Model.check_reasonable_tolerance(units, tolerance)
    if tol_msg is not None:
        give_warning(ghenv.Component, tol_msg)

    # create the model
    model = Model(
        shapes_, boundaries_,
        units=units, tolerance=tolerance, angle_tolerance=angle_tolerance)
    model.display_name = _name_ if _name_ is not None else 'unnamed'
name: FF Model
description:
Create a Fairyfly Model, which can be used for simulation.
-
